document_data.mainbody:
Inara al-Munsif was a princess of Hudid in the Pantheist League of interior Zakhara in 1367 DR.
Inara inherited many of her mothers good traits. She was polite and preferred to lead by example.
Educated and determined, Inara chose to follow her mothers path as a moralist. She rose steadily through the ranks of the church and later served as the caliphs Chief Vizier. She was the caliphs legs and voice throughout the city of Hudid.
Inara was tasked with determining the validity of accusations that Balanite heretics were operating out of Hudid.
Inara was born in Huzuz.
Inara was the daughter of Caliph Sajah al-Munsif. Jinara was her sister.
